chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brad Alan Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC
No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brad Alan Mitchell

records.addlTxt: Operating without Owner's Consent: Affirmative Defense
Returned NSN

8:43 AM Defendant Brad Alan Mitchell in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Brad Alan Mitchell.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that defendant plead to sole count. For count 1, withheld sentence for 1 year probation. Conditions of probation include pay mandatory court costs, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, serve 8 days jail with credit for 8 days and continuation of no violent or abusive contact with Victim 1. State has complied with Victim's Rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Attorney Reid stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court imposes for sole count, withheld sentence for 1 year probation. Conditions of probation include pay mandatory court costs, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, serve 8 days jail with credit for 8 days and continuation of no violent or abusive contact with Victim 1.
No violent or abusive contact with victim 1 as listed in ID key.
No violent or abusive contact with victim 1 as listed in ID key.

8:44 AM Defendant Brad Alan Mitchell in court.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Brad Alan Mitchell.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case, quashes warrant, questions current address.
Attorney Reid indicates general delivery; staying at 1226 Grand, Superior
Court questions FTA
Attorney Reid-came to see pd to talk about case this morning before he thought court today.  Made a mistake and was a day late.
State-shows 6/28/22 fta-showed up late that day, had right date/wrong time.  Appears to be having trouble keeping the exact date and time; would normally ask for some cash but doesn't want to contribute to pretrial incarceration.  Reviews criminal history; MN and WI.
State requests $250cb no v/a cont V1
Defense requesting sb be reinstated;  only has $12 on him. Local ties; previously employed in Superior.
Court reviews arguments; cites concerns. Questions defendant on maximum amount of cash able to post.
Defendant indicates he doesn't have any more money or anyone else to call.
Court vacates forf sb.  Orders $250 cash and $2000 signature bond and conditions requested by the state.
Defense indicates that defendant is able to post $100; person in the courtroom can post the cash.
Court denies request to lower bond.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:13 AM Defendant Brad Alan Mitchell not in court.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Brad Alan Mitchell.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Reid has no information on the nonappearance. Upon defendants failure to appear, State requests warrant and forfeiture of any bond. Court grants warrant, Douglas and adjoining counties plus Ashland, and forfeiture of any bond previously ordered. State notes that the count has been amended to class A misdemeanor.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brad Alan Mitchell not in court. Upon defendants failure to appear, State requests warrant and forfeiture of any bond. Court grants warrant, MN and WI, and forfeiture of any bond previously ordered. Preliminary hearing is taken off the calendar.

2:35 PM Court recalls case. Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brad Alan Mitchell in court. Attorney Ryan Reid in court with his client. Court quashes warrant, questions non appearance. Defendant believed his court appearance was at 3:00 today. State reviews that defendant was on $3,000 signature bond asks that preliminary hearing for tomorrow be reset, witness could be reset. State notes that this is not the first attorney check. Reviews previous criminal history. Not opposed to reinstating signature bond. Attorney Reid agrees with the reinstatement of bond. Defendant does qualify for public defender services, but public defender's office does not have an attorney available for tomorrow. Court orders $3000 signature bond be reinstated. Time limits have already been waived. 
Preliminary hearing set for July 13, 2022 at 8:45 AM.

Defendant appears, Attorney Lalor for the state.
Defendant has not obtained counsel; requesting to reset.  Waives time limits for PH. Court accepts.
Court resets PH
No violent or abusive contact with Victim

3:32 PM Defendant Brad Alan Mitchell in court.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan Reid makes a special appearance on behalf of the defendant. Attorney Reid notes that the defendant does not qualify for the public defender's office. Asks that the preliminary hearing be rescheduled to allow defendant time to obtain counsel. State is in agreement to resetting the prelim. Attorney Reid indicates that the defendant will waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court finds that the waiver was knowingly and voluntarily made. Defendant indicates that he believes he should have an attorney by June 1. Attorney Reed asks for a reset to June 8. State indicates that the victim is asking to remove the bond conditions of no contact with Victim 1 and their residence. The conditions have been amended to no violent or abusive contact with the victim.
Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim 1 or their address. Third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement. One time contact with law enforcement for property retrieval.

1:44 PM Defendant Brad Alan Mitchell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Chad La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Ellen Craker makes special appearance OBO Dfd. 
Dfd acknowledges receipt of complaint, ID key.
Ms. Craker makes special appearance and verifies Dfd's address. 
Court amends complaint to show new address.
Atty Craker waives reading ask prelim hearing.
Chad La Lor request $1000.00 cash, no contact victim 1 or their address. This was filed by warrant and was extradited from Duluth, not sure how long he's been in Superior. Priors MN 2013 domestic, 2011 DWI, 2008 improper transport hydroniums ammonia, 2006 domestic, 2005 domestic assault, has pending charge in MN receiving stolen property. 
Atty Craker argues bail, don't think case necessary, he's lived in Superior 3 years and don't see any missed appearances in his past. Not sure what notice he received for hearing. He is employed right now, don't think cash is necessary. 
Court indicates heard cases but no missed appearances and orders $3000.00 signature bond, no  contact w/victim 1 or their address and notes address is same as Dfd gave on the record today. Court questions if Dfd has alternate address.
Dfd states he can stay with sister at 111 3rd Ave in Duluth. 
Court questions where Dfd is employed
Atty Craker states he is employed at towing company in Duluth and requests 3rd party contact for children. 
Atty La Lor indicate the victim is an ex and doesn't have info regarding children. 
Court orders conditions of no contact with victim with exception of third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement. Also, one time contact with law enforcement for property retrieval.
Ms. Craker indicates Dfd does not qualify for PD
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
